snippet: In a sign of escalating frustration in Turkey after days of cross-border shelling with Syria, Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan lashed out against the United Nations’ inaction in Syria.
abstract: Turkey's Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan lashes out at United Nations’ inaction in Syria with his strongest comments yet, saying world powers are repeating mistakes they made in Bosnia in the 1990s; also calls for change in structure of the Security Council, where reluctance by any member, in this case, China and Russia, can stymie action.

byline.original: By SEBNEM ARSU and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu reported from Istanbul, and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon. Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Beirut, and Ellen Barry from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: In a sign of escalating frustration in Turkey after days of cross-border shelling with Syria, Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan lashed out against the United Nations’ inaction in Syria.

headline.main: Turkey Faults U.N. Inaction Over Syria
headline.print_headline: Turkey Faults U.N. Inaction Over Syria
